title: [iOS] App crashes while using Status app when user recovered his account from a seed phrase

milestone.title: 1.27.0 - Alpha
milestone.description:
### This release will be used for internal dogfooding

Mobile dev team priorities In priority order:

**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 1.26 cycle**

**2. Select which accounts to share with each Community's control node**
- Designs should be ready for review and dev feedback by 18th September

**3. Settings home screen**
- the settings home screen only

**4. Fix bugs, both functional and UX fit-and-finish defects.**  

- specifically focus on bugs related to the Communities functionality, when a community is utilizing all the community admin functionality available in Status Desktop

- any remaining UX quality defects

- ensure all community token gating related functionality is working

body:
# Bug Report


## Problem 
[comment]: # (A problem description)
Floating bug. 
We tried to reproduce it by every mobile QA member.
Only 2 of 4 QA's faced with this issue.
Please, use our steps to catch this tricky little monster.

#### Expected behaviour
No crashes while using Status app when user recovered his account from a seed phrase 

#### Actual behavior
Random crashes : 
- right after Onboarding
- after user start to explore Status app

### Reproduction

1. Install app
2. Sign up a new user using a seed phrase
3. Go through onboarding (in this place I had a stuck on "Key saved" step once, shaked logs attached(unfortunately, we can only get such shake logs as we use a logcat only for Android)
[status_logs.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/14050233/status_logs.zip)
5. Communities screen opens (I also had a crush on this step)
6. Make some actions like: chatting, friend request (Diana catched crush on these steps 1-2 times randomly)
*please, let us know if you'll need some additional info or our seed phrase

### Additional Information

- Status version: PR builds ([first ](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/18523) and [second](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/18449))
- Operating System: iOS
- Devices: iPhone SE, ios 17.2.1; iPhone 13, ios 17.2.1


[comment]: # (Please, add logs/notes if necessary)
